what: Get Metadata for All KWB-R Github Repos

title: Analyse R Packages on Github
text: Now limit “public” KWB-R repos R packages.

title: Analyse R Packages on Github
code: # Define paths and resolve placeholders paths_list <- list(   root_dir = tempdir(),   pkglib = "<root_dir>/pkg-lib",   pkgsource_dir = "<root_dir>/pkg-source",   pkgnet_dir = "<root_dir>/pkgnet",   pkgsource_zip_dir = "<pkgsource_dir>/zip",   pkgsource_unzip_dir = "<pkgsource_dir>/unzip" )  paths <- kwb.utils::resolve(paths_list, root_dir = tempdir())

title: Analyse R Packages on Github
code: ### On Travis already installed within .travis configuration ### https://github.com/KWB-R/pkgmeta/blob/master/.travis.yml ### with function  pkgmeta::travis_pkg_install_script()

title: Codemetar Analysis
code: library(jsonld) library(jsonlite) library(magrittr) library(codemetar) library(purrr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'purrr' #> The following object is masked from 'package:magrittr': #>  #>     set_names #> The following object is masked from 'package:jsonlite': #>  #>     flatten library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(printr) #> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'printr': #>   method                from      #>   knit_print.data.frame rmarkdown library(tibble) ################################################################## ### Importing "codemetar.json"  ##################################################################  ### Option 1: ### Not working correctly (-> gives list that is twice as long as just ### using jsonlite::fromJSON as defined below  # frame <- system.file("schema/frame_schema.json", package="codemetar") #  # corpus <- jsonld::jsonld_frame("codemetar.json", frame) %>% #  jsonlite::fromJSON("codemetar.json", #                              simplifyVector = FALSE) %>% #   getElement("@graph")   #"https://kwb-r.github.io/pkgmeta/codemetar.json" %>%   #  jsonlite::fromJSON() %>%  #  jsonlite::write_json("codemetar.json")  ### Option 2: working as expected  corpus <- jsonlite::fromJSON("codemetar.json",                              simplifyVector = FALSE)  ### add Github topics to R package names pkg_topics <- tibble::tibble(        name = purrr::map_chr(corpus, "identifier"),        topic = purrr::map_chr(                lapply(purrr::map(corpus, "keywords"),                        function(x) {paste(unlist(x),                                           collapse = ", ")}),1)) pkg_topics topics <- tidyr::separate_rows(pkg_topics, topic, sep = ",\\s+") %>%    dplyr::count(topic) %>%    dplyr::filter(!topic %in% c("r", "rstats")) %>%    dplyr::arrange(dplyr::desc(n)) %>%    dplyr::rename(word = topic,                 freq = n)    knitr::kable(topics) wordcloud2::wordcloud2(topics)

title: Codemetar Analysis
code: ## deal with nulls explicitly by starting with map pkgs <- purrr::map(corpus, "name") %>%   purrr::compact() %>%   as.character()  # keep only those with package identifiers (names) keep <- purrr::map_lgl(corpus, ~ length(.x$identifier) > 0) corpus <- corpus[keep]  ## now we can just do all_pkgs <- purrr::map_chr(corpus, "name") head(all_pkgs) #> [1] "algoliar: Simple Access to Algolia Search REST API"                                                    #> [2] "aquanes.report: Automated Reporting Tool for Water Suppliers"                                          #> [3] "dwc.ar4gw: R Package for Preparing Modflow Output Data for Articifical\n        Reality Visualisation" #> [4] "dwc.wells: A Package for Condition Predictions for Drinking Water Wells"                               #> [5] "fakin.path.app: Shiny App to Visualise File Paths"                                                     #> [6] "fhpredict: R Package for the Project Flusshygiene"  ## 3 unique maintainers purrr::map(corpus, "maintainer") %>%     purrr::map(1) %>%     purrr::map("familyName") %>%    unique() %>%   length() #> [1] 5

title: Codemetar Analysis
code: ## Mostly Hauke maintainer <- purrr::map(corpus, "maintainer") %>%     purrr::map(1) %>%     purrr::map("familyName") %>%   unlist() %>%    tibble::enframe(name = NULL) %>%   dplyr::group_by(value) %>%   dplyr::tally(sort=TRUE) %>%   dplyr::rename(word = value,                 freq = n)   knitr::kable(maintainer) wordcloud2::wordcloud2(maintainer,                        minSize = 0.4,                         size = 0.6) ## number of co-authors ... purrr::map_int(corpus, function(r) length(r$author)) %>%   tibble::enframe() %>%   dplyr::group_by(value) %>%   dplyr::tally(sort=TRUE) ## Contributors isn't used as much... purrr::map_int(corpus, function(r) length(r$contributor)) %>%   tibble::enframe() %>%   dplyr::group_by(value) %>%   dplyr::tally(sort=TRUE)

title: Codemetar Analysis
code: purrr::map_int(corpus, function(r) length(r$softwareRequirements))  %>%   tibble::enframe() %>%   dplyr::group_by(value) %>%   dplyr::tally(sort=TRUE) corpus %>%   map_df(function(x){     ## single, unboxed dep     if("name" %in% names(x$softwareRequirements))       dep <- x$identifier     else if("name" %in% names(x$softwareRequirements))       dep <- map_chr(x$softwareRequirements, "name")     else { ## No requirements       dep <- NA     }      tibble(identifier = x$identifier, dep = dep)   }) deps_df <- tibble(identifier = purrr::map_chr(corpus, "identifier"),        deps = lapply(purrr::map(corpus, "softwareRequirements"),                       FUN = function(x) {                        deps <- purrr::map_chr(x, "name") %>%                            unlist() %>%                            paste(collapse = ",") %>%                           as.character()                                                deps <- ifelse(stringr::str_length(deps) > 0, deps, NA_character_)}))  dep_df <- tidyr::separate_rows(deps_df, deps, sep = ",") %>%    dplyr::select(deps, identifier) %>%   dplyr::arrange(deps, identifier) %>%    dplyr::rename(dependancy = deps, used_in_r_package = identifier)     #which dependencies are used most frequently? dep_count <- dep_df %>%   dplyr::group_by(dependancy) %>%   dplyr::tally(sort = TRUE) %>%   dplyr::rename(word = dependancy,                 freq = n)  knitr::kable(dep_count) wordcloud2::wordcloud2(dep_count,                        minSize = 0.4,                         size = 1)

title: Codemetar Analysis
code: #Alternate approach using a frame instead of purrr functions for subsetting the #Note that this gets all Depends and suggests (really all SoftwareApplication #types mentioned) dep_frame <- '{   "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/codemeta/codemeta/master/codemeta.jsonld", "@explicit": "true", "name": {} }' dep_sug_count <- jsonld_frame("codemetar.json", dep_frame) %>%   fromJSON() %>%   getElement("@graph") %>%   filter(type == "SoftwareApplication") %>%   group_by(name) %>%   tally(sort = TRUE) %>%   dplyr::rename(word = name,                 freq = n)   knitr::kable(dep_sug_count) wordcloud2::wordcloud2(dep_sug_count,                        minSize = 0.4,                         size = 1)

title: Visualisation
code: r_releases <- pkgmeta::plot_r_releases() #> Warning: Expected 3 pieces. Missing pieces filled with `NA` in 13 rows [1, 2, 6, #> 11, 15, 18, 20, 22, 23, 25, 27, 31, 33]. htmlwidgets::saveWidget(widget = r_releases,                          file = "r_releases.html") r_releases

code: @Manual{,   title = {pkgmeta: R Package for Meta-Analysis of KWB-R Packages on Github},   author = {Michael Rustler},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.2.0},   url = {https://github.com/KWB-R/pkgmeta}, }

title: R Package for Meta-Analysis of KWB-R Packages on Github
text: installing latest release R package run following code :
code: # Enable repository from kwb-r options(repos = c(   kwbr = 'https://kwb-r.r-universe.dev',   CRAN = 'https://cloud.r-project.org'))    # Download and install pkgmeta in R install.packages('pkgmeta')  # Browse the pkgmeta manual pages help(package = 'pkgmeta')

title: R Package for Meta-Analysis of KWB-R Packages on Github
text: Checkout available articles use R package.

title: Create codemeta — create_pkg_codemeta
code: create_pkg_codemeta(   pkgs = get_github_packages(),   libpath = Sys.getenv("R_LIBS_USER"),   dbg = TRUE )

title: Create codemeta — create_pkg_codemeta
text: pkgs data frame R packages (default: get_github_packages()) libpath libpath  (default: Sys.getenv("R_LIBS_USER")) dbg debug messages printed? (default: TRUE)

title: Create Universe Packages JSON — create_universe_pkgs_json
text: Prepares packages.json file required R-universe creating personal CRAN-like repository R-universe

title: Create Universe Packages JSON — create_universe_pkgs_json
code: create_universe_pkgs_json(   group = "KWB-R",   ignore_pkgs = NULL,   non_r_packages = kwb.pkgstatus::get_non_r_packages(),   github_token = Sys.getenv("GITHUB_PAT") )

title: Create Universe Packages JSON — create_universe_pkgs_json
text: group default: "KWB-R" ignore_pkgs vector pkg names ignored prevent problems codemeta generation (e.g. "kwb.read" fails due missing metadata license!) non_r_packages vector repos R packages (default: kwb.pkgstatus::get_non_r_packages()) github_token optionally Github token order access private repositories (default: Sys.getenv("GITHUB_PAT"))

what: Helper function: download private repos from Github — download_github
title: Helper function: download private repos from Github — download_github
text: Source code: copied "remotes" https://github.com/r-lib/remotes/blob/bd970d723facc6ede2ff0f54ce4ae917526a37f8/install-github.R (required downloading private repos!)

title: Helper function: download private repos from Github — download_github
code: download_github(   repo,   ref = NULL,   dest_dir = tempdir(),   use_zip = FALSE,   quiet = FALSE,   auth_token = Sys.getenv("GITHUB_PAT") )

title: Helper function: download private repos from Github — download_github
text: repo Github repo (e.g. "kwb-r/kwb.utils") ref default: "NULL" (.e. defaults "master" "main" branch) dest_dir dest directory (default: tempdir()) use_zip files downloades .tar.gz (use_zip=FALSE) .zip files (use_zip=TRUE); default: FALSE quiet print messages (default: TRUE) auth_token auth_token (needed download "private" repos), default: Sys.getenv("GITHUB_PAT")

title: Helper function: download private repos from Github — download_github

code: get_gh_ratelimit() #> # A tibble: 8 × 5 #>   id                          limit  used remaining      reset #>   <chr>                       <int> <int>     <int>      <int> #> 1 core                         5000  1141      3859 1654098069 #> 2 search                         30     0        30 1654096401 #> 3 graphql                      5000    16      4984 1654098072 #> 4 integration_manifest         5000     0      5000 1654099941 #> 5 source_import                 100     0       100 1654096401 #> 6 code_scanning_upload         1000     0      1000 1654099941 #> 7 actions_runner_registration 10000     0     10000 1654099941 #> 8 scim                        15000     0     15000 1654099941

code: if (FALSE) { #repos <- kwb.pkgstatus::get_github_repos(github_token = Sys.getenv("GITHUB_PAT")) #repos <- repos$full_name repos <- paste0("kwb-r/", c("aquanes.report", "kwb.ml", "kwb.utils")) pkgs_commits <- pkgmeta::get_github_commits_repos(repos) head(pkgs_commits) }

title: Get Github R Packages — get_github_packages
text: group default: "KWB-R" ignore_pkgs vector pkg names ignored prevent problems codemeta generation (e.g. "kwb.read" fails due missing metadata license!) non_r_packages vector repos R packages (default: kwb.pkgstatus::get_non_r_packages()) github_token optionally Github token order access private repositories (default: Sys.getenv("GITHUB_PAT"))

title: Plot Github Package Releases Over Time — plot_github_pkgs_releases
code: if (FALSE) { pkgs <- get_github_packages() pkgs_releases <- github_packages_versions(repos = pkgs$full_name) plot_github_pkgs_releases(pkgs_releases) }
